comingle.comms.listeners

Class ListeningPost<D extends java.io.Serializable,A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • comingle.comms.datapipe.DataPipeManager<D,A>
        • comingle.comms.listeners.ListeningPost<D,A>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - Type of administrative data that data pipe handles
    A - Type of address that nodes uses
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger, Neighborhood, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseDirectory

    public abstract class ListeningPost<D extends java.io.Serializable,A>
extends DataPipeManager<D,A>
implements Logger, Neighborhood
    Listening Post abstract class that manages a data pipe and introduces NodeInfo listening functionality.
    Author:
    Edmund S.L. Lam

    • Method Detail

      • addDirectoryChangedListener

        public void addDirectoryChangedListener(DirectoryChangedListener listener)
        Add a directory changed listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked every time this directory is updates.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeDirectoryChangedListener

        public void removeDirectoryChangedListener(DirectoryChangedListener listener)

      • addConnectionEstablishedListener

        public void addConnectionEstablishedListener(ConnectionEstablishedListener listener)
        Add a connection established listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked every time this directory has established a connection.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeConnectionEstablishedListener

        public void removeConnectionEstablishedListener(ConnectionEstablishedListener listener)

      • addRoleEstablishedListener

        public void addRoleEstablishedListener(RoleEstablishedListener listener)
        Add a role established listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked each time this directory transit from an 'unknown' role state to a known role state.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeRoleEstablishedListener

        public void removeRoleEstablishedListener(RoleEstablishedListener listener)

      • addLocalNodeInfoAvailableListener

        public void addLocalNodeInfoAvailableListener(LocalNodeInfoAvailableListener listener)
        Add a local node info available listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked when the node info of the local node is available.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeLocalNodeInfoAvailableListener

        public void removeLocalNodeInfoAvailableListener(LocalNodeInfoAvailableListener listener)

      • addOwnerTerminationListener

        public void addOwnerTerminationListener(OwnerTerminationListener listener)
        Add an owner termination listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked when the directory has been notified that the owner node is no longer active.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeOwnerTerminationListener

        public void removeOwnerTerminationListener(OwnerTerminationListener listener)

      • addNetworkStatusChangedListener

        public void addNetworkStatusChangedListener(NetworkStatusChangedListener listener)
        Add a network status changed listener to this directory. Listener operations are invoked when doNetworkStatusChangedActions is invoked.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • doWifiAdapterStatusChanged

        public void doWifiAdapterStatusChanged(boolean enabled)
        Invoke network status changed listeners. The doWifiAdapterStatusChangedAction of each listener will be called. This method is intended to be called by a network monitoring service (e.g., a BroadcastReceiver that registers on network events.).
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the wifi adapter is enabled.

      • doWifiConnectionStatusChanged

        public void doWifiConnectionStatusChanged(boolean connected)
        Invoke network status changed listeners. The doWifiConnectionStatusChangedAction of each listener will be called. This method is intended to be called by a network monitoring service (e.g., a BroadcastReceiver that registers on network events.).
        Parameters:
        connected - true if the wifi adapter is connected to some network.

      • removeNetworkStatusChangedListener

        public void removeNetworkStatusChangedListener(NetworkStatusChangedListener listener)
